cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of Marathon, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing WNW across the Florida Keys, then northwestward across the east-central Gulf toward the Mississippi/Louisiana coastline and inland over the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast (near the MS/AL border to southeast Louisiana)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch is posted from the AL/FL border westward to east of Morgan City, LA including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Watch from the MS/AL border westward to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts expected along the central Gulf Coast from the western Florida Panhandle to southeast Louisiana; lower impacts possible westward to the Louisiana-Texas border
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible mid-week; only a 12 % chance of sustained 34-kt winds, most likely late Wednesday into Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible near the LA-TX border, less than 3 ft at Port Arthur
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain in squalls late Wednesday–Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes possible in outer rainbands if the center passes slightly farther west
